ETYMOLOGY: From German Semester, from Latin sēmestris ('of six months'), from sex ('six') + mēnsis ('month').
SINCE: Late 18th century (in English, referring to German universities)

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A half-year term or division of the academic year, especially in colleges and universities.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 学期（尤指大学或高等教育机构中的半年制学期）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She is taking five courses this semester to complete her degree faster.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她这学期选了五门课，以便更快地完成学位。
